page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The area that we are surveying is the area immediately surrounding Ashurst. The land is mainly covered by Forestry Commission Woodland. The Forestry Commission are a group of people who look after the forests. The area also includes some farm land and some heath & marsh land. There is a camping site and thus the area is used for recreation puposes such as walking and picnicing. The area covers the southern half of Ashurst and the area to the south. The grid also contains the source of the Beaulieu River. It also contains the A35 main road and some of the Southampton to Bournemouth railway line. The areas main attraction is the forest but it also has the New Forest Butterfly farm. This is a well known local attraction.
